item.title: Need help adding d claws
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Nicksworld, post:5, topic:547583”]Lol I cant believe i skipped over that… thats why i hate having to type shit i forgot caps.
Thanks i love you no homo.
And now the claws are invisible when equipped, i did add model 44590 and 43600[/quote]
If they’re invisible, the model isn’t added.
You can say “I added model bla bla” a million times.
I don’t care.
The logic here is, if it’s invisible. it’s not added.
Based on how you’re saying you added each model, sounds like you’re using code to pack the models specifically, one by 1.
You could always use index repacking, which would add all the models into the cache (like actually into it, you’ll no longer need the .dat files), but some corrupt caches will not allow this.
You can also preload the models. This is typically everyones solution. You throw the models into a “raw” folder, and they all load on startup.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/snippets/323269-index-repacking.html
^How to index repack.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help adding d claws
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Nicksworld, post:3, topic:547583”]With the code changed to "wield"
http://prntscr.com/52blw5[/quote]
As I said:

sk8rdude461:

Note: Wear is supposed to be for items you put on your head, torso, neck, arms, feet, legs… Not your hands. Do you “wear” a sword? Don’t think so. You “Wield” it. Not that the action name matters. It could be “take a toke” for all I care, the wield packet will still work.

The action name doesn’t mean much.
ANNND I see your error. This is why I needed to see the two codes…

[quote=“Nicksworld, post:3, topic:547583”] itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";[/quote]
See that? that’s from your chaotic…
Now look at your dragon claw code once more…

[quote=“Nicksworld, post:1, topic:547583”]case 14484: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear"; break;[/quote]

Like I said here:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:547583”]The only issue I see is the option to “wear” isn’t showing… Which in that case half of what you told us doesn’t matter…
Is it possible that “actions” is for the ground actions?
Can we see another item in your code for comparison…[/quote]

change actions to itemActions.
/thread

Read full topic

heres a chaotic weapon

case 11740: itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.modelID = 35084; //drop model itemDef.anInt165 = 35085; //male wield model itemDef.anInt200 = 35085; //femArmModel itemDef.modelZoom = 1425; itemDef.aByte154 = -14; itemDef.modelRotationY = 540; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1370; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -1; itemDef.aByte205 = -12; itemDef.aByte154 = -12; itemDef.anInt188 = -1;//female sleeve itemDef.name = "Chaotic rapier"; itemDef.description = "A reward from Dungeoneering".getBytes(); break;

item.title: Need help adding d claws
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Uhm… What?

Nicksworld:

Okay in my itemdef i dont have a spot for hard coded items… so i put them under the staff of the dead.

So if your itemdef doesn’t have a spot for hard coded items, how does it have the staff of dead in the same file?
The staff of dead would also be a “hard coded item”… AKA, A custom.
Note: Wear is supposed to be for items you put on your head, torso, neck, arms, feet, legs… Not your hands. Do you “wear” a sword? Don’t think so. You “Wield” it. Not that the action name matters. It could be “take a toke” for all I care, the wield packet will still work.

I’m confused on your error, though…
What seems to be the issue? the models look added? I can’t tell if you have a wield issue because you didn’t specify. You just gave us 2 pics of the item in the invo…

The only issue I see is the option to “wear” isn’t showing… Which in that case half of what you told us doesn’t matter…
Is it possible that “actions” is for the ground actions?
Can we see another item in your code for comparison…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help adding d claws
item.dc:creator: @Nicksworld Nicksworld
item.description:
@Nicksworld wrote:

Okay in my itemdef i dont have a spot for hard coded items… so i put them under the staff of the dead.

case 14484: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.modelID = 44590; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt165 itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 43600;//anInt200 itemDef.modelZoom = 789; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 240; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -23; itemDef.name = "Dragon claws"; itemDef.description = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); break;
So they don’t give me an equip option it says use.
Now you guys are going to say it needs to say wield but everything is wear in my itemdef.java so yeah.
I got to claws to show like this
http://prntscr.com/52b6yb
http://prntscr.com/52b747
